description:
Loughlin Park' - 197.68 Acres of Productivity
Loughlin Park' is located 20 minutes North of Ballarat, 15 minutes from Daylesford & 10 minutes to Creswick and offers 197.68 acres or 80 hectares on one title with two sealed road frontages. Highly productive, this farm is one of the best examples of Farm Management you will find.
Zoned Farming, the current owners have renovated the pastures and improved production with the application of poultry manure and lime, and have direct drilled 90% of pastures over the last 10 years. The soil types vary from Red, Grey to Black Loam. There are 10 paddocks with troughs fed by town water, 4 dams and an unequipped stock bore insuring an abundance of water in the toughest of seasons.
The undercover working improvements are outstanding with the cattle yards (handling 100+ head), scales, a vet crush and adjustable loading race combined with high quality lighting via 3ph and 240v power enables work at night. Three large hay shed that hold approx. 600 large bales plus a large machinery shed with 3ph power add to the properties working facilities. The property currently carries approx. 100 grown head of Angus cattle. There is also 9 additional acres in which are currently leased by the Vendors from council, and could potentially be carried on by the new owners (STCA).
A comfortable 3 bedroom brick veneer home with open plan living, electric cooking, gas hot water system, wood heating, reverse cycle air conditioning and town water makes for comfortable living. The home also has potential to be leased at approx. $250 per week.
This is a rare opportunity not to be missed as Loughlin Park Black Angus' are renowned quality beasts and all are A1 blood line. This property could easily be run as a horse breeding or agistment property as the facilities are easily converted if desired.
Note: 30 acres of sown pasture that produced 150 large square bales last year will be locked away for the new owner to cut hay (conditions apply). Available to purchase separately is the livestock and more than 500 straws of semen which are approx. worth between $100 - 500 per straw.
Bonus Inclusions: The Vendors will include approx. 300 big square bales plus 250 bales of silage and a quantity of lime and poultry manure. This has a current value of approx. $50,000
Expressions of Interest close 9th September at 4.00PM at the offices of PRD Nationwide Ballarat and PRD Nationwide Buninyong.
PRD Nationwide Agents in Conjunction: Neville Dooly 0419 307 882 & Chris Leonard 0409 0409 23.

Reduce your carbon foot print in Bush setting on approx 20 acres
This low maintenance 3 bedroom solar home has you relaxing as soon as you arrive. Seclusion without being isolated in its location, has bitumen road frontage. Property features 1km of walking/bike tracks and an abundance of native wildlife. If gold detecting is your thing, you may not be disappointed. Enjoy the peace & quiet of the bush while you relax on the front deck. Just a few minutes to centre of historic Talbot to take advantage of the famous Farmers Market 3rd Sunday of the month. Close to the Pyrenees Wine district and only 15mins to Maryborough or 45mins to Ballarat.
Includes:
Solid fuel heater in living area with ample firewood on property
Lpg hws/cooker/fridge (gas & electric)
500 watts Inverter with Back up generator (new)
Water Tanks x3 plus Dams x2
Shipping container, lock up Shed & 3x Carport
Good Fencing with Dual access
For more information please call Jo Millar on 0438 081 301 or Angela Flowers on 0437 456 908 to arrange your appointment for inspection

Fabulous Modern Design Overlooking Historic Creswick
This exciting young home is set in the heart of town and has stunning views as far as the eye can see. The abode's construction finished Australia Day three years past. Proportions through the trendy residence are generous with each bedroom taking your king size suites. The master has a walk through robe and a private intimate sanctuary with plumbing for you outdoor shower/bath. The kitchen is open plan to the vast dining and lounge room. This sunny area has fantastic natural light collecting all day sunshine. Chefs can appreciate the use of either the modern stainless steel hot plate and oven or the upright combustion stove. The dwelling has great winter comfort with gas and wood heating. A large balcony area takes the entertaining from inside to out. Guests will for-ever rave about the scenery. The parcel is large enough for a small allotment to be subdivided for a townhouse (STCA). All this just one minutes stroll to the hub of town and the knowledge of knowing one will never be built out or have neighbors across the road will please. The home is currently let and brings a tidy return. Bills are kept low cost with a 6.7 energy rating.

IVYBANK, A PART OF SMEATON HISTORY
Located just 15 minutes from Daylesford and 30 minutes to Ballarat, this historic farm of approx 124 acres (50.18 hectares) with a long boundary to Birches Creek was established in 1857 and has been by the same family for three generations since 1928. The family farmhouse, located at the end of a long private driveway, has been renovated to provide relaxed living, and there are a huge number of outbuildings - farm and machinery shedding, workshops, plus a studio and historic miner's hut. A must see property in this picturesque and historic area.
- Approx 124 acres (50.18 hectares), one title
- Traditional farmhouse with welcoming country kitchen, large adjoining lounge with wide undercover deck/entertaining area, 4 bedrooms, 1 bathroom
- Adjacent studio/office plus historic hut (originally a miner's office/gold depot relocated from Clunes goldfields)
- Huge machinery shed/workshop, plus undercover parking for 8 vehicles
- Prolific bore, plenty of rainwater storage, good fencing with several paddocks
- Dairy cattle from early 1900's until 1970's then beef cattle, sheep grazing and cropping
- Birches Creek boundary permanent creek from Newlyn Reservoir and Hepburn Lagoon to Andersons Mill, Clunes and Tullaroop Reservoir.

SECLUDED MINERS COTTAGE ON OVER 6.5 ACRES - MELB SIDE OF TOWN
Hardly ever found in this location is this simple but surprisingly sound 120 year old miners cottage. The home itself has 3 good sized bedrooms, central living area, plenty of space for cooking and dining, plus internal bathroom and toilet. Outside on the sensational cleared approx 6.6 acres, enjoy the benefit of the massive shed with high clearance plus other shedding. Add to this the benefits of excellent fencing, good water supply and fantastic views of the area. Don't forget this property is very hard to find with its acreage, Melbourne side of Ballarat.
James Waterhouse : 0408 382 551

Stylish Family Entertainer on Approx. 3 Acres
Featuring two stunning 100-year-old oaks and many other mature trees, this property is intriguing and inviting, both inside and out. Outdoors, there are lawns and flower beds, a tree house, water features, vegetable patches, a potting shed with its own toilet and a bitumen tennis court. Filled with natural light, and offering a warm white and soft pastel palette and polished hardwood floors, this four-bedroom home has been updated with a separate shower room to complement a shower-bath combination in the family bathroom. The overall floor plan is perfect for growing families of any age. The kitchen has been designed with the perfect U' shape to facilitate a three-point working triangle, and features a double St George oven, timber benches and generous storage. Split system and combustion heating provide choices for comfort in all seasons, with exposed beams and ceiling fans adding to the overall character of the home.
A well-protected alfresco area extends the entertainment zones outdoors. A new septic treatment system has been added, providing recycled water to the garden. There are three sheds, two with power connected, and the third serving as a wood shed. This very secluded property, that comes with your own kangaroos and other wildlife, is just moments from the Doug Lindsay Recreation Reserve, Creswick Primary School and, of course, all the delights for which Creswick is renowned. This property can only be appreciated by inspecting. Call our agent today for further details, land measurements and inspection times.

A True Family Entertainer On Almost An Acre
This stunning, yet private abode has spotted gum floorboards, vast bathrooms and kitchen with granite benchtops, butler's pantry, stainless steel appliances and a chef's size oven. Three living rooms, two outdoor sitting areas and a bungalow-rumpus make entertaining a breeze. The pool adds to the excitement. A 16.5 x 9m garage and further shedding is sure to please. Just a short 20 minute drive to Daylesford.

AFFORDABLE WEEKENDER
Approx 7 acres of predominantly cleared land only 15 minutes drive from Maryborough and 35 minutes from Ballarat. The land is zoned farming, fenced with camping shed and dam. Phone available. Affordable recreational property with easy access and country views.

Glorious Life Style Farms
Lot 1: 20acres-Strathlea Road-$140,000
This block is rectangular shaped block on the east side of Strathlea Road. The block is predominantly cleared, but includes a section of bush towards the rear of the block. Strathlea Road is fully constructed. Mains electricity is readily available.

Practical, Low Maintenance Home
A modest yet extremely functional family home is awaiting your inspection. Completely surrounded by new colourbond fencing and teamed with matching house highlights, carport, garage & garden shed, this weatherboard home provides a low maintenance property just minutes from the centre of the bustling main street of Creswick and the Doug Lindsay Reserve. Set on approx. 800m2 and benefiting from freshly planted shrubs and a backdrop of neighboring trees, this home would work particularly well for new home buyers, retirees or investors looking for an easy, carefree investment.
A practical floor plan with loads of natural light and warmth, this three bedroom residence delivers a generous living, dining and kitchen area along with well-proportioned cosy bedrooms, a family bathroom and independent laundry. The kitchen provides a sea of overhead cupboards and drawers, plenty of bench space for food preparation along with stainless steel electric appliances adding to the functionality of the open plan zone. A strategically placed split system comforts the entire home, with quality carpet and durable floor coverings providing a serviceable surface through the wet areas. A front and back porch provide additional areas to watch the sunrise and sunset, while the shed includes enough space for a workshop as well as a vehicle.
Coming up 11 years old, this property is presented with a welcoming new feel, which is perfect for those wishing to start afresh. Located on a No through road ensures a little further peace and quiet, while the heart of Ballarat is just 20 minutes away along the Midland Highway for city experiences and culture. Call our agent today for extra details of this fabulous offer.

HOBBY FARM AND QUALITY BRICK HOME
Set on approx. 16 acres is this quality built brick home. With two living spaces and a freestanding wood heater there is plenty of room for the whole family. The timber kitchen boasts storage galore and allows room for dining, this is truly a country kitchen.
Each of the three bedrooms includes BIR's and the master with ensuite. Main bathroom has separate shower and bath and is well maintained. There is also a separate toilet.
Out back there is an undercover entertaining space, with built in BBQ and fernery.
Fully fenced, the acreage is currently one large paddock bordered to the rear with a seasonal creek. There is loading ramps for stock as well as an open bay hay shed. There are mature fruit trees galore, including apricot, fig, olive, apples, this list goes on and on. Large water tanks ensure adequate water storage and the property has mains power. Large double carport as well as a double garage with its own tank and workshop, ensures the whole family has room to move.
To inspect, call LUKE WILLIAMS on 0415 104 044 at our Maryborough office today.
Luke Williams : 0415 104 044

Country Lifestyle Living On 2000sqrm
Have you been looking for an affordable brand new home with all the benefits of Country Living? Then this may be just what you are after. This G J Gardner 25+sq home has just been finished to a high standard. Boasting 3 bedrooms and study, master with WIR and ensuite with BIR's in the remaining bedrooms. Open plan kitchen living/dining as well as separate lounge. Attached double garage and concrete driveway. Keep comfortable all year round with electric ducted heating and cooling. Outside there is nothing left to do with all the fencing completed, formal entry to the property as well as instant turf to be laid prior to settlement by the vendor. You can also relax and unwind in the covered outdoor entertaining area that captures the great country vistas. This is a great opportunity to live the country life without all the hard work. Only a short drive from Ballarat and just 6 minutes to Creswick. Be sure to call today to find out more.

BEAUTIFUL 1.206 Ha ( 3 ACRES) IN CHARMING SMEATON
Here is the place to build your dream home! Picture-perfect north facing hillside block on Mill Hill with panoramic views across its gorgeous green valley and the Smeaton volcano's and historic bluestone Anderson Mill in the distance.
Don't let this chance pass you by. A further 2-3 acres of crown land (yours to utilise upon application to council) and the permanently flowing, trout-filled Birch's creek, clear and deep, run along the lower side of the property. It's a corner block with only more beautiful vacant land as your neighbour, quiet Elizabeth St on the upper boundary and even quieter Moorookyle St down the other side. You'll be only a few minutes' walk (700m) to the friendly town centre and local pub/store and just 20-25 minutes to Daylesford, 10 minutes to Crewswick and 30 minutes to Ballarat.
Great, easy access to power and town water but town water will probably be unnecessary as a solar bore has been installed to provide as much crystal clear, drinking quality mineral water as you need for free forever! Recently acquired current planning permit exists for large dwelling and garage. All the hard work has been done for you. This incredibly rare site is just waiting for someone to build the exceptional house it deserves.
Smeaton village offers an excellent lawn bowls club and community centre and a regular bus service. Wonderful, quiet, family oriented community and close to all your needs.

address: Greenhill/130 Telegraph Road Mount Prospect VIC 3364
description:
Rich & productive land with 110mgl water - 218 acres approx.
Situated in the highly prized location just north of Ballarat, is this opportunity to secure a significant holding in the renowned horticultural precinct of Mount Prospect.
Divided into 7 main paddocks and on two titles, about 85% of the total property area has been under potatoes at various stages, rotating with cereals and cattle/prime lambs. On the eastern edge of the property there is some higher ground giving sweeping views of the district and beyond.
A laneway leads to centrally located and historic structural improvements including a double story character filled Bluestone barn with loft, timber Hayshed (50m x 25m approx.), 2 stand Woolshed and serviceable cattle and sheep handling facilities. Included also is 6 x 50tonne grain silos, and a vintage chaff cutter and wool press.
The main 80m depth irrigation bore rated at 20,000 gal/hr is equipped with a shedded electric Franklin submersible 60HP/45kw pump with Techo variable drive, servicing the irrigation needs of the property. There is 110 megalitres of seasonal water entitlement included with the sale.
There are a further 3 stock and domestic bores on the property, one equipped with a 3cylinder Izuzu Diesel engine and pump
Fencing is in excellent to serviceable condition; two portions are currently being replaced on southern and eastern sections and will be complete by settlement.
DEPOSIT: 10% deposit on signing of contracts.
SETTLEMENT: within 60/90 days.

2 Bedroom home on 3 titles
This well kept home sits on 2100m2 (approx 1/2 acre) right in the centre of historical Talbot. Enjoy the benefits of location with the general store across the road, 2 blocks from the primary school & train station and prime position for the famous Talbot Farmers Market.
Features include:
High ceilings
Wood heating/split system
Electric hws/cooking/dishwasher
Undercover bbq area/established Garden
Excellent shedding with rear access.
Only 10 mins to Maryborough or 40 mins from Ballarat
For more information please contact Jo Millar on 0838 081 301 or Angela Flowers on 0437 456 908

NEAT HOME AND STUDIO WITH STUNNING DISTRICT VIEWS
If you have been looking for the perfect small acreage country escape with great district views this two bedroom brick veneer home plus studio could be perfect for you. In addition to the 2 acres on title there is a further option for a 1.5 acre leasehold on an adjoining allotment. The property offers excellent shedding, low maintenance native gardens and open paddocks for the ponies. The house has two bedrooms, one with robes and there is a generously proportioned living area with open fireplace. There a dining area, sun-room and a galley style kitchen. There is a further large studio/bedroom and an outside loo. There is a two car lock up garage and workshop, horse shelter, chook shed and the makings of a great pizza oven. The property has excellent access to water with both tank and bore water supplies. Located 20 minutes from Castlemaine, Daylesford, Maryborough and Creswick this is a central position and a charming country setting!

Escape to the Country on 14 Acres
If youve been looking for the ideal country lifestyle on a rural property this farmlet has it all, offering a modern home on 14 productive acres (approx.) located in the tightly held hamlet of Smokeytown. Located just a short 3-minute drive to Creswick and 20 minutes to Daylesford and Ballarat.
This energy efficient, fully insulated 5-year-old home offers 3 generous sized bedrooms with BIR, 2 bathrooms, open plan living/dining/kitchen with a separate full laundry/mudroom. Stay warm in the winter with double glazed windows, a large wood heater, split system heating cooling and ceiling fans for circulation. Be the envy of your friends with a large undercover decking/entertaining area with specular views over the rolling countryside.
Some other facilities offered include:
-A recently constructed 12m x 16m colour bond shed that holds up to 6 cars, with double electric roller doors, drive through and partitioned utility room
-Multiple other shedding included a fully lined bungalow & poultry shedding
-3 x Tanks with a 92,000 litres capacity plus 2 x dams
-6 Paddocks with electric fencing
-Remote controlled electric gates
-2 x Horse paddock shelters
-Vegie garden plus established trees
Inspections are by private appointment only and are highly recommended.

Contemporary Classic, Walk to Town
This Colonial classic exudes historical charm from the street while internally this home exhibits another era of living. A number of changes have been made since its 1800's construction, with the faade boasting a colourbond roof and a blend of refreshing colours, new concrete stumps and freshly painted weatherboards, while the interior now offers a contemporary open plan design with fresh paint and an updated kitchen and dining zone, three bedrooms and 21st century bathroom and European laundry.
With timber laminate floors and freestanding robes (which will stay with the sale), this home really will offer you a stylish modern place to enjoy for years to come. The light filled kitchen boast a waterfall bench top, stainless steel appliances and under bench cupboards and drawers, while the pendent lighting adds a further visual effect to the serving space and overall entertaining area.
Comfortable on its own, the living area is warmed by gas heating while a recessed area for the television has been cleverly designed to free up the surrounding floor space or walk area. The family bathroom offers a double door multifunctional spa shower with bath, with a separate toilet and the external European laundry creates further space to the internal living areas.
The raised deck to the rear provides clear caf blinds for all season' entertaining, while the Doug Lindsay Recreation Reserve and the massive 1030m2 of land, creates an uninterrupted view or an opportunity to further develop (STCA). A planning permit to extend the home is still current, and is available to the new purchaser. There is also the added bonus of fibre NBN.
Finished with a pretty picket fence and a tiered side yard with 2 single garages, this property also boasts an internal contained back yard for pets and children's care along with a further outer colourbond fence for boundary delineation. Walk to the shops, hospitals and/or dining outlets, make an ideal first home choice or a stylish weekend retreat. Brimming with character and stories, where interesting times and events would have been enjoyed, this property in the centre of Creswick will continue to bring a lifetime of family memories. Call our agent today for further details, land measurements and inspection times.

2.07HA (5.11 Acres) Birdwood Close A Haven For The Discerning Buyers
Beautifully presented and architect designed and built by the highly regarded Melbourne based firm Fasham, Birdwood Close is a contemporary sanctuary that has been meticulously planned to incorporate a range of sustainable concepts such as energy and water savings and permaculture principles. Spacious,the home accommodates 3 queen-size bedrooms (Ensuite & WIR'S to main), roomy home office/studio, informal and formal living zones. There is an abundance of natural light with vaulted ceilings, spectacular north facing double glazed floor to ceiling windows that overlook the property's established gardens. A fully appointed kitchen features electric appliances, dishwasher as well as working slow combustion stove, ample storage and preparation space with island bench, WIP and insulated wine cellar and attic. The home's carefully considered floorplan places the master at one end of the home with the other bedrooms situated at opposing ends of the home. Outdoor improvements include double carport offering direct access to the home, American style barn, combined tank storage of 40,000 litres, four dams and established gardens including fruit trees, Shiraz vineyard and raised rabbit proof garden beds. Situated in a tranquil yet convenient location, Talbot is a historic and charming village within 2 hours drive from Melbourne and only 15kms from Maryborough. Call today to further discuss the many and varied features and benefits of the quality property and to arrange your private viewing which is assured to impress. More information can be found at http://birdwoodclose.weebly.com/

Sweet & Affordable In Picturesque Kingston
This charming home is set in one of Victoria's hidden little secret locale's. The abode boasts three spacious bedrooms all taking your large suites and having lovely views over the countryside. A visit to the property will show the residence sits almost in the middle of an approximate half acre allotment. The straight and sturdy home has an open plan kitchen, meals and lounge. Only six minutes to Creswick and under twenty to Daylesford the dwelling could be a fantastic weekender.

Stunning Lifestyle & Home In Golf Course Estate
"Just spectacular" is how this home and offered lifestyle has been described. The young home overlooks a dam, fairway and green whiles being surrounded by native vegetation, kangaroos and birdlife. Set in a quiet court in The Goldfields Estate, the occupier is a short stroll to the 19th Hole (restaurant and bar), under ten minutes to Ballarat and approximately 20 minutes to Daylesford. Boasting three large bedrooms and a stunning open plan kitchen, meals & lounge the quality of finish matches the lifestyle granted. The kitchen's splashback has to be seen to be believed. The stainless steel appliances including the 900mm upright stove will please. With the living area facing North East it chases the sun, while ample heating and cooling deliver all year comfort. So if you love golf, nature or beautiful scenic walks this home is for you.
